Peabody High School The Golden Tide!
2019 TSSAA 2A State Champs Back to Back
Walter Kilzer Stadium The Golden Tide!

div.class: custom_153020 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomInUp

img.alt: PreK and K Registration May 5 and 6

div.class: custom_151112 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomInUp

p.span: This afternoon, Governor Bill Lee recommended the closure of all schools for the remainder of this school year. Trenton Special School District will comply with the recommendation and will not return to school this school year. Tim Haney, Director of Schools shared, “In response to this action, Trenton Special School District's Administration Team will soon formalize its plan for continuing instruction. Please check social media and the TSSD website in the coming days for next steps to support our students, parents, and community. We appreciate your support and patience as we work together through this unprecedented time of the COVID-19 pandemic.”

span.font: "With this final closure of the school year, there are many questions that remain to be answered. The administration team of each building will soon be posting answers to the many open questions that you may have. We understand that a great many of them will be related to grades, high school events, and graduation. We are currently awaiting guidance from the State Department of Education concerning the logistics of closing schools. Later this week, as we learn more, we will post more information with the details you will need for your child to successfully close out this school year.

We will continue to provide meals on Mondays and Wednesdays and our teachers will continue to contact our families each week. Our faculty and staff miss our students greatly and we are saddened by this announcement of the closure of the school year, but we will handle this adversity in a positive manner and make best-interest decisions for students, parents, staff, and Trenton".

div.class: custom_142276 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomInUp

p.strong: Trenton Special School District Meal Service – April 2, 2020

div.p: Trenton Special School District will provide breakfast and lunch to all children ages 18 and under for the remainder of this week and during the weeks of Monday, March 30 through Friday, April 24, 2020. Meals will be available at no cost to each child. In order to receive a meal, the child must be present during meal pickup. The child will be able to receive both meals consecutively.

p.strong: Meals will be distributed on Mondays and Wednesdays through April 24th. Two days of meals will be distributed on Monday and three days on Wednesdays at the mentioned locations. On Monday, April 6th, meals will be available at Trenton Elementary from 10:00 am to 6 pm. (This is the same day and time that packets will be handed out at all three schools.)

div.p: In order to help us determine your child’s nutritional needs, a google document is available at www.trentonssd.org. Based on your feedback, meal quantities, and if needed, delivery schedules will be revised.
Please continue to check the district website for updated information.
For any questions, please call 731-487-2914 - Lisa Seiber-Garland
This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

p.span: Click the link below to sign up for a no cost meal. Meal services will be provided for breakfast and lunch.

li.span: Any child living in the home that is 18 and under can be provided a meal at no cost.
Children must be present when meals are picked up.

p.span: Meals can be picked up between the hours of 8 -11:30 at Trenton Elementary School and 8:00 – 8:15 at all other locations daily.
Please click on the link to sign up for meals for grab and go!

div.class: custom_142728 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomInUp
custom_146754 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomInUp

u.strong: Tennessee Teacher of the Year Candidate

div.p: Peabody High School is pleased to announce that Mrs. Katie Bruketta has been selected as a regional finalist for Teacher of the Year, an honor only held by 26 others across the state (K-12.) She now qualifies to compete for 2019-20 Tennessee Teacher of the Year, in May. Congratulations and Best Wishes, Mrs. Bruketta!

div.class: custom_135570 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomInUp

u.strong: TSSD Teachers of the Year for 2020

tr.td: Congratulations to these 3 TSSD instructors upon being named Teacher of the Year in a vote of their building (TES, TRMS, PHS) peers.

div.class: custom_124716 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomInUp
div.p: Mr. Allen was selected as part of the TAAE 10 for 10 Cohort for the 2019-2020 school year. Chosen for their years of service to our profession and their dedication to the continual learning process, these teachers will receive a stipend to attend either the 2019 National Association of Agricultural Educators Conference in Anaheim, CA or the 2020 NAAE Region 5 Conference in Memphis, TN. At both of these conferences, the teachers will attend meetings, tours, and seminars to enhance their knowledge about agriculture education so that they can bring new techniques and excitement into their classrooms where they shape the future of agriculture. Thank you for your continued support of agriculture education!
